exercise.p: Determine four solutions of the equation 2x - 5y = 2, including at least one solution with a negative value and one solution that uses decimals or fractions.

aside.p: Whenever you write points as ordered pairs, you must write the parentheses. Don't be lazy!

exercise.p: Plot the point (4, 2) and draw a visualization for both conceptualizations of locating that point.
Plot the point (-3, -4) and draw a visualization for both conceptualizations of locating that point.
Determine 4 solutions of the equation x - 3y = -2, including at least one solution with a negative value and one solution that uses decimals or fractions.
Plot the point (0, 3) and draw a visualization for both conceptualizations of locating that point.

aside.p: Zeros throw students off for some reason.

exercise.p: Find four solutions of the equation 2x - 3y = 1. Plot the points and sketch the solution.

aside.p: Try to pick points that fit on the given coordinate grid when plotting points. You will sometimes need to use off-grid points, but you should try to avoid that because the plots become increasingly inaccurate when you do.

exercise.p: Determine 4 solutions of the equation 2x - 3y = -5, including at least one solution with a negative value and one solution that uses decimals or fractions.
Plot the point (-5, 0) and draw a visualization for both conceptualizations of locating that point.
Find four solutions of the equation -x + y = 3. Plot the points and sketch the solution.
Each chart represents some solutions of a linear equation, but the equation of that linear equation isn't given. Determine three more points on the line based on the existing solutions.

aside.p: This is something of a puzzle that is built on your experience. If you're really stuck, try sketching the graph and looking for a pattern.

exercise.p: Find four solutions of the equation -3x - y = 4. Plot the points and sketch the solution.
Find four solutions of the equation x = -3. Plot the points and sketch the solution.

aside.p: When there is no restriction on the value, it means that you can pick the to be anything you want.

exercise.p: Each chart represents some solutions of a linear equation, but the equation of that linear equation isn't given. Determine three more points on the line between the given points.
Each chart represents some solutions of a linear equation, but the equation of that linear equation isn't given. Determine the missing coordinates based on the given points.
Find four solutions of the equation 4x - 3y = -3. Plot the points and sketch the solution.
